section.title: Identification
section.para: This document is for Listen Subscribers.
This document is for Listen Administrators.
This document is for Listen Custodians whose role is to create new organization(s), assign appropriate feature(s) and configure routing number(s).

section.title: Minimum System Requirements
section.para: In order for you to access all of the Listen features, the system must meet the following minimum requirements:

listitem.para: Web Browser (Internet Explorer 8 or higher or Firefox 3.5 or higher)
JavaScript is enabled in your browser. Follow the steps below to enable JavaScript for your browser type:

Internet Explorer: Go to Tools in the file menu and select 'Internet Options'. Go to the 'Security' section and click on the 'Custom Level' button. Once there, scroll down to a section called 'Scripting' and select 'Enable' for 'Active Scripting'.
OR
Firefox: Go to Tools in the file menu and select 'Options'. Go to the 'Content' section and select the check box for 'Enable JavaScript'.

section.title: System Overview
section.para: Listen consists of the following licensable features:

listitem.para: Conferencing: Listen Conference is a fully automated, full-duplex conferencing system, utilizing enhanced digital audio conferencing technology that requires no operator intervention, resulting in a state of the art system that supports scheduled and on the fly conferences. It supports multiple simultaneous conferences of two or more participants.
Two conference modes are available:

"OnDemand" - This mode allows the host to dial out to all conference participants bringing them together into one conference call. No extra steps are required by the participants, they simply have to answer their phone.

"MeetMe" - This mode allows the host to have a dedicated conference up and ready for their conference participants to join. The host will assign either an active or passive pin to each participant, which they use to join the conference after dialing in to a pre-determined telephone number. "MeetMe" conferences also allow the host to dial out to bring additional participants into the call via the "OnDemand" feature.

There is a Telephone User Interface (TUI) and Graphical User Interface (GUI). The Telephone User Interface (TUI) is used by all participants of the conference, whereas the Graphical User Interface (GUI) can only be accessed by administrators and hosts.
The following actions are available through the TUI:
Hosts:
Start Conference
Initiate outbound call
Initiate OnDemand conference (while in conference)
Record a Conference
Roll call of waiting participants (conference not started)
Roll call during conference
Passive/Active mode (own line)
Passive mode - The participant is muted. They can listen to the conference, but they cannot contribute.
Active mode - The participant can listen and contribute to the conference.
Passive/Active mode (active participant)
Drop participant from conference (except for another conference administrator)
End conference
Active Participants:
Listen/talk
Roll call during conference
Passive/Active mode (own line)

para.emphasis: Note: If a host places a participant in passive mode, that participant cannot place themselves back into the active mode.

listitem.para: Passive Participants:
Listen only
A host can perform the following actions through the GUI:
Create new conference subscriber accounts
Schedule a conference - sends an email request to the listed participants to join a conference
View conference information (conferences in use, conferences configured, etc.)
View participants of an active conference (phone numbers)
Place a participant in passive or active mode (any participant line, except for another conference administrator)
Drop participant from conference (except for another conference administrator)
Initiate outbound call
Record a Conference

Voicemail: Listen Voicemail is a fully automated voicemail system. It allows subscribers to receive, store and retrieve voicemail through both a Telephone User Interface (TUI) and Graphical User Interface (GUI).
Features can be performed through the Telephone User Interface (TUI) only, through the Graphical User Interface (GUI) only or both.
Mailbox Maintenance
Change greeting (TUI only)
Change Passcode
Listen to messages
Delete messages
Forward messages (TUI only)
Reply to sender (TUI only)
Mark messages as new/old (GUI only)
Download messages (GUI only)
Fax: Listen Fax is a fully automated Fax system. It allows the subscribers to send and receive fax in the PDF format through the Graphical User Interface (GUI).
Features that can be performed through the Graphical User Interface (GUI)
Sending a fax
Receiving a fax

Find Me/Follow Me: Listen Find Me/Follow Me is a fully automated Find Me/Follow Me system. It allows the subscribers to enable, disable and delete the number(s) on the Find Me/Follow Me list through both a Telephone User Interface (TUI) and Graphical User Interface (GUI).
Features that can be performed through the Telephone User Interface (TUI) only, through the Graphical User Interface (GUI) only or both.
Add a number (GUI only)
Enable a number
Disable a number
Delete a number
Attendant: Listen Attendant is a fully automated attendant system. It allows the administrators to map key presses to applications.

section.title: Document Overview
section.para: This document contains screen shots and instructions on how to navigate the TUI and GUI for conferencing and voicemail.
This document contains screen shots and instructions on how configure and manage your Listen system.
This document contains screen shots and instructions on how to configure your organization(s) on your Listen system.
The following formatting conventions are used within the guide:

listitem.para: All notes are indented and italicized.
All field names are in bold.

section.title: References
section.para: Listen Setup Guide - Installation, Configuration & Operations
VoIP Phone Configuration Guide
VoIP Phone Quick Start Guide
Listen User's Guide - For Subscribers
Listen User's Guide - For Administrators
Listen Conference Quick Start Guide
Listen Voicemail Quick Start Guide

section.title: Telephone User Interface (TUI)
section.para: There are three separate Telephone User Interfaces:

listitem.para: Conferencing
Voicemail
Find Me/Follow Me

para.emphasis: Note: All changes made on the TUI are also reflected on the GUI.

section.title: Conferencing
section.para: The TUI has the following PIN specific features:

listitem.para: Hosts:
Start Conference
Initiate outbound call (conference not started)
Initiate OnDemand conference (while in conference)
Roll call of waiting participants (conference not started)
Roll call during conference
Passive/Active mode (own line)
Passive mode - The participant is muted. They can listen to the conference, but they cannot contribute.
Active mode - The participant can listen and contribute to the conference.
Passive/Active mode (active participant)
Drop participant from conference (except for another host)
Record conference
End conference
Active Participants:
Listen/talk
Roll call during conference
Passive/Active mode (own line)

para.emphasis: Note: If a host places a participant in passive mode, that participant cannot place themselves back into the active mode.

listitem.para: Passive Participants:
Listen only

section.title: Host Menus
section.para: The following menus are available to the host:

para.emphasis: Main Menu

section.para: This menu is accessed upon ending a conference.

listitem.para: The following options are available:
Press 1 to make a call.
Press 2 for conferencing.

para.emphasis: Admin Menu

section.para: This menu is accessed upon entering the conferencing system.

listitem.para: A message is played stating if any participants are waiting for the conference. The following options are available:
Press 1 to start your conference.
Press 2 to listen to a roll call of waiting participants (see Roll Call of Waiting Participants).
Press 3 to make a call (see Initiate Outbound Call).

para.emphasis: Conference Menu

section.para: This menu is accessed by pressing * at any time during the conference

listitem.para: The following options are available:
Press 1 for roll call (see Roll Call During Conference).
Press 2 to toggle mute (see Passive/Active Mode).
Press 3 to record the conference (see Record Conference).
Press 4 to end the conference (see End Conference).
Press 5 to make a call.
Press any other key to return to the conference.

para.emphasis: Roll Call Menu

section.para: This menu is accessed by pressing 1 from the Conference Menu.

listitem.para: The following options are available:
Press 1 to place participant in passive (mute) mode (see Passive/Active Mode (active participant)).
Press 2 to place participant in active mode (see Passive/Active Mode (active participant)).
Press 3 to drop participant from conference (see Drop Participant from Conference).
Press 4 to restart roll call.
Press any other key to return to the conference.
Each participant name is played.

para.emphasis: Note: If there are no participants in the conference, you are returned to the Conference Menu.

listitem.para: Once all participant names have been played, an "End of roll call" message is played and you are returned to the Conference Menu.

section.title: Host Features
section.para: The following features can be performed by the host only.

section.title: Start Conference
section.para: The steps to start a conference are the same for hosts of both "MeetMe" and "OnDemand" conferences.

listitem.para: Dial into the conference number.
A Welcome message is played and you are prompted to enter your PIN.
Enter your PIN and press #.
Record your name and press #. You are taken to the Admin Menu.
Press 1 to start the conference.
An entry tone/name is played for each participant currently waiting.
Press * at any time to go to the Conference Menu.

section.title: Initiate Outbound Call
section.para: An outbound call can be initiated at any time prior to or during a conference. This can be used with both "OnDemand" and "MeetMe" conferencing.
To perform an outbound call:

listitem.para: Select dial option:
From the Main Menu, Press 1.
From the Admin Menu, Press 3.
From the Conference Menu, Press 5.
Press 1 for an interactive call.
OR
Press 2 for an automated invite (no further action required by the host).
Enter the destination number and press #.

para.emphasis: Note: For Voice Over IP (VOIP), use '*' key in place of '.'.

listitem.para: If the call cannot be completed or the party does not answer the call, you are returned to the previous menu.
The party called answers the phone. Press the * key to hear the available options:
Press 1 to add the party to the conference.
Press 2 to end this call.
Call is ended. Called party does not join conference.
You are returned to the previous menu.
Press any key to return to your call.
You are reconnected to the called party.
Press 1 to add the party to the conference.
You are returned to the previous menu.
The called party is prompted to record their name.
If the conference is already in progress, they are added as an active participant.
If the conference has not started, they are placed on hold until it starts.

section.title: Initiate "OnDemand" Conference (while in conference)
section.para: An "OnDemand" conference can be initiated at any time during a current conference. This is used to add additional participants to the conference.
To perform an "OnDemand" call:

listitem.para: Press * to get to the Conference Menu.
Press 5 to make a call.
Press 1 for an interactive call
OR
Press 2 for an automated invite (no further action required by the host).
Enter the destination number and press #.

para.emphasis: Note: For Voice Over IP (VOIP), use '*' key in place of '.'.

listitem.para: If the call cannot be completed or the party does not answer the call, you are returned to the previous menu.
The called party answers the phone. Press the * key to hear the available options:
Press 1 to add the party to the conference.
Press 2 to end this call.
Call is ended. Called party does not join conference.
You are returned to the previous menu.
Press any key to return to your call.
You are reconnected to the called party.
Press 1 to add the party to the conference.
You are returned to the Conference Menu.
The called party is prompted to record their name. An entry tone and their name is played as they join the conference.

section.title: Roll Call of Waiting Participants (conference not started)
section.para: Prior to starting a conference, the host can hear a listing of participants currently waiting for the conference to start.

listitem.para: At the Admin Menu, Press 2 to listen to a roll call of waiting participants.
Each participant name is played.

para.emphasis: Note: If there are no participants in the conference, you are returned to the Admin Menu.

listitem.para: Once all participant names have been played, an "End of roll call" message is played and you are returned to the Admin Menu.

section.title: Roll Call During Conference
section.para: During the conference, the host can hear a listing of participants currently on the conference.

listitem.para: Press * to get to the Conference Menu.
Press 1 to get to the Roll Call Menu.
The available options are played.
Each participant name is played.

para.emphasis: Note: If there are no participants in the conference, you are returned to the Conference Menu.

listitem.para: Once all participant names have been played, an "End of roll call" message is played and you are returned to the Conference Menu.
Press any key (except 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5) to return to the conference.

para.emphasis: Note: This can be done at any time during the roll call.

section.title: Passive/Active Mode (own line)
section.para: During the conference, the host can place himself in passive or active mode.

listitem.para: Press * to get to the Conference Menu.
Press 2 to toggle yourself to passive/active mode.
A message is played that you are now in passive or active mode.
Press any key (except 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5) to return to the conference.

section.title: Passive/Active Mode (active participant)
section.para: During the conference, the host can place an active participant in passive or active mode.

para.emphasis: Note: A host cannot perform this action another host or a passive participant.

listitem.para: Press * to get to the Conference Menu.
Press 1 to get to the Roll Call Menu.
A message is played stating the available options.
Each participant name is played.

para.emphasis: Note: If there are no participants in the conference, you are returned to the Conference Menu.

listitem.para: Press 1 when the name of the participant you wish to place in passive mode is played,
A message is played stating whether or not the participant was placed in passive mode.
OR
Press 2 when the name of the participant you wish to place in active mode is played.
A message is played stating whether or not the participant was placed in active mode.
Once all participant names have been played, an "End of roll call" message is played and you are returned to the Conference Menu.
Press any key (except 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5) to return to the conference.

section.title: Drop Participant from Conference
section.para: During the conference, the host can drop any passive or active participant.

para.emphasis: Note: A host cannot drop another host.

listitem.para: Press * to get to the Conference Menu.
Press 1 to get to the Roll Call Menu.
A message is played stating the available options.
Each participant name is played.

para.emphasis: Note: If there are no participants in the conference, you are returned to the Conference Menu.

listitem.para: Press 3 when the name of the participant you wish to drop is played.
A message is played asking if you wish to drop the participant.
Press 3 to drop the participant.
A message is played stating whether or not the participant was dropped.
Once all participant names have been played, an "End of roll call" message is played and you are returned to the Conference Menu.
Press any key (except 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5) to return to the conference.

section.title: Record Conference
section.para: During the conference, the host can record (start or stop) the conference.

listitem.para: Press * to get to the Conference Menu.
Press 3 to record/stop recording the conference.
A message is played stating whether or not the recording was successfully started/stopped.
Press any key (except 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5) to return to the conference.

section.title: End Conference
section.para: During the conference, the host can end the conference.

listitem.para: Press * to get to the Conference Menu.
Press 4 to end the conference.
A message is played to all participants stating that the conference administrator has ended the conference.
You are taken to the Main Menu.
Hang up.

section.title: Participant Menus

para.emphasis: Conference Menu

section.para: This menu is accessed by pressing * at any time during the conference

listitem.para: The following options are available:
Press 1 for roll call (see Roll Call During Conference).
Press 2 to toggle mute (see Passive/Active Mode).
Press any other key to return to the conference.

section.title: Participant Features
section.para: The following features can be performed by participants of the conference.

para.emphasis: Note: Participants who join the account with a passive PIN can only listen to the conference. They cannot hear the roll call or place themselves in an active mode.

section.title: Join Conference
section.para: Each participant (Active/Passive) joining the conference must know the conference number and have an access PIN.

listitem.para: Dial into the conference number.
A Welcome message is played and you are prompted to enter your PIN.
Enter your PIN and press #.
Record your name and press #.

If the conference has not been started, a message is played indicating that the conference has not started and on hold music is played. The music will continue to play until the conference is started by the host.
If the conference has been started, a message is played indicating that you are being put into the conference. An entry tone and your name are played.

section.title: Roll Call During Conference
section.para: At any time in the conference, an active participant can hear a listing of participants currently on the conference.

listitem.para: Press * to get to the Conference Menu.
Press 1 for roll call.
Each participant name is played.

para.emphasis: Note: If there are no participants in the conference, you are returned to the Conference Menu.

listitem.para: Once all participant names have been played, an "End of roll call" message is played and you are returned to the Conference Menu.
Press any key (except 1, 2, 3, or 4) to return to the conference.

section.title: Active/Passive Mode (own line)
section.para: At any time in the conference, an active participant can place himself into passive or back to active mode.

para.emphasis: Note: If the host has placed the participant in passive mode, that participant loses this functionality until the host places them back into active mode.

listitem.para: Press * to get to the Conference Menu.
Press 2.
A message is played that you are now in passive or active mode.
Press any key (except 1, 2, 3, or 4) to return to the conference.

section.title: Voicemail
section.para: Each subscriber will have their own voicemail box. The following features are available:

listitem.para: Listen to messages (new and saved)
Save messages
Delete messages
Forward messages
Reply to messages
Record a mailbox greeting
Change a mailbox passcode

section.title: Mailbox Menus
section.para: The following menus are available:

para.emphasis: Mailbox Menu

section.para: This menu is accessed upon entering a valid mailbox number/passcode.

listitem.para: The following options are available:
Press 1 to retrieve a message.
Press 2 for mailbox maintenance.

para.emphasis: Message Menu

section.para: This menu is accessed after each message is played.

listitem.para: The following options are available:
Press 1 to go to the next message.
Press 2 to reply to sender.
Press 3 to delete the message.
Press 4 to rewind the message
Press 5 to save the message.
Press 6 to fast forward the message
Press 7 to repeat the message back.
Press 8 to response to the caller.
Press 9 to restart from the beginning of the message.
Press 0 to forward this message.
Press * to replay the menu options.
Press # when finished.

para.emphasis: Mailbox Maintenance Menu

section.para: This menu is accessed by pressing 2 from the Mailbox Menu.

listitem.para: The following options are available:
Press 1 to change your mailbox greeting.
Press 2 to change your passcode.
Press any other key to return to the previous menu.

para.emphasis: Record Menu

section.para: This menu is accessed after recording the mailbox greeting.

listitem.para: The following options are available:
Press 1 to save.
Press 2 to listen to the recording.
Press 3 to re-record.
Press 4 to return to the previous menu.

section.title: Access Mailbox
section.para: You can access your mailbox from:

listitem.para: Your own extension:
Dial the internal Listen voicemail number.
Enter your passcode and press #.
Someone else's extension:
Dial the internal Listen voicemail number.
Press *.
Enter your mailbox number and press #.
Enter your passcode and press #.
An external phone:
Dial the external Listen voicemail number.
Press *.
Enter your mailbox number and press #.
Enter your passcode and press #.

section.title: Listen/Skip/Save/Delete Messages
section.para: Messages stored within your mailbox can be listened to, skipped, saved and deleted.

listitem.para: At the Mailbox Menu, press 1.
The current message count is played (# of new and old messages).
Messages are played in the following order:
New messages only
New and old messages - Each new message is played, followed by the old messages.
Old messages only
No messages - A message is played stating that there are no messages and you are returned to the Mailbox Menu.

para.emphasis: Note: The order that the messages are played in (newest to oldest or oldest to newest) is based on the subscriber's settings. See

listitem.para: The first message is played followed by the Message Menu options.
Press 1 to go to the next message. The message state is changed from new to old.
Press2to reply to sender. The message state is changed from new to old.
Press 3 to delete the message. The message is deleted from the mailbox.
Press 4 to rewind the message. The message can be rewind to the part where you want to listen.
Press 5 to save the message. The message state is changed from new to old.
Press 6 to fast forward the message. The message is fast forward for 5 seconds.
Press 7 to repeat the message. The message is played again followed by the Message Menu options.
Press 8 to respond to the message. The message state is changed from new to old.
Press 9 to restart from the beginning of the message. The message state remains unchanged.
Press 0 to forward the message. The message state is changed from new to old.
Press * to replay the menu options.
Press # when finished. The message state is changed from new to old.
If no option is selected, the message is saved and the state changed from new to old.
The next message is played followed by the Message Menu options. This continues until all messages (new and old) have been played.
Once all messages have played, you are returned to the Mailbox Menu.

section.title: Forward Message
section.para: Messages stored within your mailbox can be forwarded to another mailbox.

listitem.para: At the Mailbox Menu, press 1.
After the message you wish to forward is played, press 0.
Enter the mailbox number you wish to forward the message to and press #.
A message is played indicating the message was forwarded.
Remaining messages are played.
Once all messages have played, you are returned to the Mailbox Menu.
At the Mailbox Menu, press 1.
After the message you wish to reply to is played, press 8.
You are forwarded to the mailbox of the subscriber who left the message.
Record your message.
Press # or hang up.

section.title: Change Mailbox Greeting
section.para: You can change your mailbox greeting at any time.

listitem.para: At the Mailbox Menu, press 2.
Press 1 to change your mailbox greeting.
Press # to return to the previous menu.
Press any other key when you hear the number with the greeting you wish to change.
Each mailbox number is played.
If no number is selected, you are returned to the Mailbox Maintenance Menu.
Press any key when you hear the number of the greeting you wish to change.
Record your message and press 3 to complete the recording.
The Record Menu options are played.
Press 1 to save the greeting and return to the Mailbox Maintenance Menu.
OR
Press 2 to listen to the greeting and then press 1 to save the greeting and return to the Mailbox Maintenance Menu.
OR
Press 3 to re-record the message. Record the message and press 1 to save the greeting and return to the Mailbox Maintenance Menu.
At the Mailbox Maintenance Menu, press any key (except 1) to return to the Mailbox Menu.

section.title: Change Mailbox Passcode
section.para: You can change your mailbox access passcode at any time.

listitem.para: At the Mailbox Menu, press 2.
Press 2 to change your passcode.
Enter the new passcode followed by #.
Re-enter the new passcode followed by #.
The passcode is saved and you are returned to the Mailbox Maintenance Menu.
At the Mailbox Maintenance Menu, press any key (except 1) to return to the Mailbox Menu.

section.title: GUI Features
section.para: The Listen GUI is made up of five separate licensable features (displayed only if licensed):

listitem.para: Conferencing
Voicemail
Find Me/Follow Me
Attendant
ACD

para.emphasis: Note: As an Administrator, the above features are also available. See the Listen User's Guide - A Subscriber's Guide for instructions on how to do the above.

section.para: As an Administrator, the following actions can also be performed:

listitem.para: System configuration
View list of all conferences (waiting and started)
Manage Subscribers
View detailed history records

section.para: As a Custodian, the following actions can be performed:

listitem.para: Organization configuration
Administration configuration
Settings configuration

section.title: Login
section.para: Log into Listen:

para.emphasis: Note: After initial install, a default custodian account is created with the following:
Username - Custodian
Password - super

listitem.para: Enter your Username.
Enter your Password.
Click

para.emphasis: Note: The Username/Password combination entered will be verified upon entry. If the combination is incorrect, a warning message is displayed.

listitem.para: After a successful login, the Messages screen is initially displayed (if licensed):

para.emphasis: Note: If Voicemail or fax is not licensed, the Conferencing screen is initially displayed. And if Conferencing is not licensed, the Find Me/Follow Me screen is initially displayed. And if Find Me/Follow Me is not licensed, the Attendant screen is initially displayed.

listitem.para: The available features are displayed as tabs. If a feature is not licensed, the tab is not displayed. To get to each feature, simply click on the feature tab.
The licensable features are:
Messages
Conferencing
Find Me/Follow Me
Attendant
The Profile tab is displayed for all users.
The Administrator features are:
Administration
Users
After a successful login, the Organizations screen is initially displayed:

section.title: Messages
section.para: The Messages screen consists of three tabs:

listitem.para: Inbox: This screen allows you to perform the following actions pertaining to voicemails and fax:
View number of new messages
View listing of new and old messages
Mark a message as new or old
Download messages
Delete messages
Send Fax: This screen allows you to send fax.
Settings: This screen allows you to manage voicemail passcode and notifications.

section.para:
Click
to display the Messages screen.

para.emphasis:
Note: The messages are initially displayed by the date/time the message was received (newest to oldest), but can be re-organized by selecting one of the column headings. To display the messages by who they are from (ascending/desending order), select the From column heading. To display the messages by the date/time they were received (newest to oldest or oldest to newest), select the Received column heading. A
or
is displayed next to the column heading to indicate the current ordering.

section.para: The number of new messages is displayed in the header and each message is displayed on a separate line. All new and old messages are displayed on the screen from newest to oldest.

listitem.para: New voicemails are displayed in blue.
Old voicemails are displayed in faded blue.
New faxes are displayed in green.
Old faxes are displayed in faded green.

section.title: Inbox
section.para:
Click
to display the Inbox screen.
Status: The text indicates the current status of the message and allows you to change the status:

listitem.para: Indicates a new/unread message. When clicked, the status of the message will be changed to old/read (see Mark Message as Old/New).
Indicates an old/read message. When clicked, the status of the message will be changed to new/unread (see Mark Message as Old/New)..

section.para: From: The caller who left or sent the message.

para.emphasis: Note: This may be a phone number, IP address, extension, name etc.

section.para: Received: The friendly text indicates when the message was received. Place the cursor over the text, the date and time (Month-dd-yyyy hh:mm:ss) the message was received appears.
Duration: The length (hh:mm) of the voicemail or the number of pages for the fax.

Delete: Click
to delete the voicemail (see Delete Voicemail).
Mark Old/Mark New: Click to mark the message as old/new (see Mark Message as old/new).

Download: Click
to download the message (see Download Message).

glossentry.glossterm: Transcription: A transcription of the voicemail.

glossdef.para: Transcription is configurable. If turned off, nothing is displayed. If turned on, one of the following is displayed:

listitem.para: Transcription Pending - This is displayed while the transcription is being generated.
Transcription Unavailable - This is displayed when there is a problem with the transcription service (see your Administrator).
Actual Transcription - This is the full text of the voicemail as transcribed by the transcription service.

section.title: Mark Message as Old/New
section.para: To mark a new message as old:

listitem.para:
Click
of the message you wish to mark as old.

The highlighting is removed and the icon switches to
.
The number of new message displayed in the header is decremented by 1.

section.para: To mark an old message as new:

listitem.para:
Click
next to the message you wish to mark as new.

The message is highlighted, it is displayed in bold and the icon switches to
.
The number of new voicemails displayed in the header is incremented by 1.

para.emphasis: Note: Any change made to the voicemails through the TUI (marking a voicemail as old, new or deleting a voicemail) is reflected on the GUI as well.

section.title: Listen to Voicemail
section.para: Voicemails can be downloaded to your computer to be saved or listened to.

listitem.para:
Click
next to the voicemail that you would like to Listen to.
The voicemail is then played in the browser.
The voicemail status is set to old/read.

section.title: Download Voicemail
section.para: Voicemails can be downloaded to your computer to be saved or listened to.

listitem.para:
Click
next to the voicemail that you would like to download.
The voicemail is downloaded to your computer to be saved or listened to using the media player of your choice.
The voicemail status is set to old/read.
A history record is generated stating that the voicemail was downloaded.

section.title: Download Fax
section.para: Faxes can be downloaded to your computer to be saved or viewed.

listitem.para:
Click
next to the fax that you would like to download.
The fax is downloaded to your computer to be saved or viewed.
The fax status is set to old/read.
A history record is generated stating that the fax was downloaded.

Click
next to the voicemail you wish to delete. The following confirmation pop-up is displayed:

Click
to delete the voicemail. The voicemail is removed from the list. If this was a new/unread voicemail, the number of new messages will be decremented by 1.

Else click
.
A history record is generated stating that the voicemail was deleted.

section.title: Send Fax
section.para: The Send Fax screen allows you to send fax to other party.

Click
and the screen appears.
Dial Number: The number to send the fax to.
Files: Select the file to send. The file must be in PDF format.

listitem.para: Enter the Dial Number.

Select the file to send. Click
to send more files.

Click
and the fax sent message appears.
A history record is generated stating that fax was sent.

section.title: Settings
section.para: The Settings screen allows the subscriber to configure voicemail passcode and notification.

Click
and the Settings screen appears.

para.emphasis: Settings Field definitions

section.para: Passcode: The passcode the subscriber must enter to access their voicemail. This can be up to 10-digits in length.

listitem.para: Newest to Oldest: Voicemails are played to the subscriber from newest to oldest.
Oldest to Newest: Voicemails are played to the subscriber from oldest to newest.

para.emphasis: Note: All new messages are played in the selected order, followed by the old messages in the selected order.

section.para: Transcribe the voicemail: Select the check box if you would like the voicemails in the GUI and on the Android app Transcribed.

para.emphasis: Note: If the organization does not have transcriptions enabled, the check box is not displayed.

section.para: Send me an email: Select the check box if an email notification should be sent to the subscriber every time a new voicemail is received.

listitem.para: Use my current email address: If selected, the email address configured from the Profile Settings tab will be used.

Use another address: If selected, the subscriber can set up another email address to receive the notification. To verify the accuracy of the address, click
. This will send a test notification to the address entered.

para.emphasis: Note: If an invalid address is provided, no warning message is displayed.

listitem.para: Add Time Restrictions: The subscriber can configure time of day and day of the week to receive the notification. Time of day can be configured as standard (AM and PM) or military.

Click
button to set up a time.

Click
button to delete the setup time.
The following information is included in the email:
Subject line: New voicemail from: <who from>
Body includes:
Text displaying who the new message is from along with the date and time (yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss) the new message was left
Total new message count
Attached voice message

section.para: Send me an SMS: Select the check box if an SMS notification should be sent to the subscriber every time a new voicemail is received.

listitem.para:
Phone Number: Enter the phone number to send the SMS notification. To verify the accuracy of the address, click
. This will send a test SMS to the phone number entered.

para.emphasis: Note: If an invalid address is provided, no warning message is displayed.

listitem.para: The following information is sent:
Text displaying who the new message is from and what number to call to retrieve it.

section.para: Phone Number: The number where the sms will be sent to.

Mobile Provider: The service provider of the number the sms will be sent to. To verify the accuracy of the phone number, click
. This will send a test notification to the phone number entered.

Send the SMS every 10 minutes until I listen to the voicemail: Select the check box if an SMS should be sent to the subscriber every 10 minutes until the new voicemail is marked as old. The SMS is sent to the SMS address entered in the 'Phone Number' field.

section.title: Edit Settings
section.para: To edit voicemail settings:

listitem.para: Enter/update the appropriate information.

Click
. A Voicemail Settings Saved message is displayed.
Updates are saved for both the GUI and TUI.

section.title: Conferencing
section.para: The Listen GUI allows administrators (system and conference) to perform the following conferencing actions:

listitem.para: View conference information
View participants of the active conference (phone numbers)
Place a participant in passive or active mode (any participant line, except for another conference administrator)
Drop a participant from the conference (except for another conference administrator)
Schedule a conference (sends an email requests to participants)
Add participant via "OnDemand"
Record a conference
View available PINs
View conference history
View and download conference recordings

section.para:
Click
from the side menu to display the Conferencing screen:

glossentry.glossterm: The Conferencing screen is split into the following tabbed sections:

glossdef.para: Manage - This screen displays the basic conferencing information.
Invitation - This screen allows you to schedule a conference by sending out an email invite to participants.
Recordings - This screen displays all of the conference recordings.

section.title: Manage
section.para: The Manage screen allows you to monitor and manage the on going conference.

glossentry.glossterm: The Manage tab is divided into the following sections:

glossdef.para: Callers - This section displays a count and listing of participants currently on the conference. From here you can place a participant in passive/active mode (see Set Participant to Passive/Active Mode) or drop them from the call (see Drop Participant).

PINs - This section displays the PINs (Personal Identification Number) that the participants will use to join the conference. When a new subscriber account is created, three 10-digit random PINs are generated by the system.
On Demand - This section allows you to add a participant to the conference. (see On Demand).
Recording - This section allows you to start/stop the recording of the conference. The View Recording List link will take you to the Recordings screen. (See Recordings).

section.title: Conference
section.para: This section displays the basic conference information and available features once a conference has been started.

listitem.para: Conference Description: The conference description.
Conference Status: The current status of the conference: Waiting for administrator or Started.
The following buttons are also available when the conference status is Started.
OnDemand: This button allows the host to add a participant "OnDemand" (see Add Participant via "OnDemand").
Record: This button allows the host to record the current conference (see Record Conference).

section.para: During a conference, a new participant can be added via "OnDemand".
To add a new participant:

listitem.para: Enter the participants phone number to dial.

para.emphasis: Note: This can be either a 10-digit phone number or an IP address.

listitem.para: If you wish to talk to the participant prior to them joining the conference, click the "Let me talk to the person first" check box.

Click
to make the call.
A request is sent to the IVR to call the participant.
A history record is generated stating that an outdial was performed.
The participant answers the call.
If the "Play pre-recorded message first" check box is selected, an automated invite is played to the participant.

If the "Let me talk to the person first" check box is selected, the host will be connected to the participant. The host can talk to the participant and join them to the conference, by pressing * and 1.
If the participant joins the conference, a history record is generated stating that the participant joined the conference.
If the participant does not join the conference, no additional history record is generated.

section.para: During a conference, the host can start a recording.
To record the conference:

listitem.para:
Click
. The button changes to
.
A history record is generated starting that conference recording has started.

Click
when done recording.
A conference audio record is created and added to the Recordings section (see Conference Recordings for details).

section.title: On the call
section.para: The host can view a listing of the current participants. As new participants join the conference, they are added to the bottom of the list and the "On The Call" count is incremented by 1 for each new participant. As participants leave the conference, they are removed from the list and the "On The Call" count is decremented by 1 for each leaving participant.

Each participant currently on the conference is listed by their phone number, extension, IP address, etc. The buttons available for each participant depends on which PIN the participant entered when joining the conference.

para.emphasis: Admin PIN:

listitem.para: The yellow star indicates an Admin. No buttons are available.

para.emphasis: Active PIN:

listitem.para: The following two buttons are displayed:

This is used to set them to passive mode.
This is used to set them to active mode.
This is used to drop the participant.

para.emphasis: Passive PIN:

listitem.para: The x circle indicates passive caller.
The following button is displayed:
This is used to drop the participant.

section.para: During the conference, the host can set participants to passive or active mode.

para.emphasis: Note: Participants in admin mode or those who joined the conference in passive mode cannot be changed.

section.para: To set a participant to passive mode:

listitem.para: Click
The participant is set to passive mode. They can now only listen to the conference.
A History record is generated stating that the participant was placed in passive mode.

section.para: To set a participant to active mode:

listitem.para: Click
The participant is set to active mode. They can now participate in the conference.
A History record is generated stating that the participant was placed in active mode.

section.para: During the conference, the host can drop passive and active participants from the conference.

para.emphasis: Note: Other participants in admin mode cannot be dropped.

section.para: To drop a participant from the conference:

listitem.para:
Click
. The following confirmation pop-up is displayed:

Click
to drop the participant. The participant is dropped from the conference and the "On The Call" count is decremented by one.

Else click
.
A History record is generated stating that the participant was dropped from the conference.

section.title: Available PINs
section.para: This section displays the PINs (Personal Identification Number) that the participants will use to join the conference.
When a new subscriber account is created, three random PINs are generated by the system:

listitem.para: Active - An active PIN is assigned to participants that you want to be able to participant in the discussion.
Admin - An admin PIN is used by the host.
Passive - A passive PIN is assigned to participants that you want to listen to the conference, but not be able to participant in the discussion.

section.title: Invitation Tab
section.para: The Invitation tab allows you to view old, current and future conferences and to schedule a new conference.

glossentry.glossterm: The Invitation tab is divided into the following sections:

glossdef.para: Schedule a Conference - This section allows you to schedule a conference by sending out an email invite to participants.
Upcoming Conferences- This section displays list of future conferences.
Past Conferences - This section displays list of old conferences.

section.title: Schedule a Conference
section.para: The Schedule a Conference section allows you to schedule a conference by sending out an email invite to participants.

Date & Time: The date (mm/dd/yyyy) for the conference, along with the start and end time. Click on the field to either enter the date manually or select the date from the calendar. Select the hour, minute and AM/PM from the drop-downs for the start and end time.
Subject: The message that will be displayed in the subject line of the email.
Message: A memo regarding the conference to be included in the email.
Active caller email addresses: The email addresses of all active participants. Separate each address with a comma or space.
Passive caller email addresses: The email addresses of all passive participants. Separate each address with a comma or space.

para.emphasis: Note: At least one email address must be entered in either the "Active caller email addresses" or "Passive caller email addresses" field.

listitem.para: Enter/select the appropriate values for each field.

para.emphasis: Note: If any information is incorrect, a warning message is displayed on the screen.

listitem.para:
Click
A confirmation message is displayed at the top of the screen indicating that emails were sent to the provided addresses. The conference is also added to the Upcoming Conferences list:

Else click
.
An email notification is sent to each participant with the request to join the conference. The following information is contained in the email:
A line indicating the name of the inviting host (if available, the subscriber's "Real Name" is used; otherwise the username is used)
The subject of the conference (if a subject was included in the "Subject" field)
Date of conference, along with the starting and ending time
Description of the conference (if a description was included in the "Message" field)
Phone Number/IP Address to call to join the conference

para.emphasis: Note: For PSTN, this is the phone number. For Voice Over IP (VOIP), this is the IP address. If the conference number is unknown, a message to contact the conference administrator is included instead.

listitem.para: PIN with status (Active/Passive)

para.emphasis: Note: Email notification is integrated with Outlook. You can accept or decline the invitation or propose a new time for the conference.

section.title: Upcoming Conferences
section.para: This section allows you to view current and future conferences.
When: The number of days or hours of the upcoming conference.
Duration: The expected length of the conference.
Subject: The subject of email that was sent for the conference.
# Invited: The number of participants invited to join the conference.
Toggle Details: Toggle to display or hide the detail of the conference. The following information are displayed:

listitem.para: Date: The date of the conference.
Time: The time of the conference.
Memo: The message of the conference.
Active Callers: The email address of the active callers.
Passive Caller: The email address of the passive callers.
Edit: This option allows you to modify the conference invitation and send out the email.
Send Cancellations: To cancel the invitation for the conference. The invitation is removed from the Outlook calendar.

section.title: Past Conferences
section.para: This section allows you to view past conferences.
When: The number of days or hours of the past conference
Duration: The length of the conference.
Subject: The subject of email that was sent for the conference.
# Invited: The number of participants invited to join the conference.
Toggle Details: Toggle to display or hide the detail of the conference. The following information are displayed.

listitem.para: Date: The date of the conference
Time: The time of the conference
Memo: The message of the conference
Active Callers: The email address of the active callers.
Passive Callers: The email address of the passive callers.
Edit: This option allows you to modify the conference invitation and send out the email.

section.title: Recordings
section.para: The Recordings tab displays all of the conference recordings.
A separate .wav file is created for each recording. Once the recording has been stopped, a record is created and displayed.

para.emphasis:
Note: The recordings are displayed 15 per page in order from newest to oldest by date/time. To view additional records click
or
.

section.para: Date: The date and time (MM-dd-yyyy hh:mm:ss) the recording was started.
Duration: The length of the recording (hh:mm:ss).
Size: The size of the .wav file that is created.

Download: Click
to download the recording (see Download Recording).

section.title: Download Recording
section.para: Each conference recording can be downloaded to your personal computer so that you can listen to it using some type of media player.

listitem.para:
Click
next to the recording that you would like to download.
The conference recording is downloaded to your computer to be saved or listened to using the media player of your choice.

section.title: Find Me/Follow Me
section.para: This feature allows you to manage incoming calls in the following fashion:

listitem.para: call forwarded to multiple numbers at once
call forwarded to different numbers in succession
combination of both

section.para:
Click Find
to display the screen.
There are two options from the 'If I don't answer' drop down menu:

listitem.para: Send the caller to my voicemail - The call is forwarded to the voicemail.
Dial - Dial the configured number(s).

section.title: Call forwarded to multiple numbers at once

listitem.para: Select 'Dial' from the drop down menu.
Enter the number in the 'Dial the following number' box.
Enter the number of seconds you want the phone to ring before proceed to next option configured below.

Click
button to add additional number(s). All of the numbers listed will be dialed all at once.

Click
button. The saved message appears on top of the screen.

section.title: Call forwarded to different numbers in succession
section.para: Call that is not answered will be forwarded to the next number in the configured order.

listitem.para: Select 'Dial' from the drop down menu.
Enter the phone number in the 'Dial the following number' box.
Enter the number of seconds you want the phone to ring before proceed to next option configured below.
Select 'Dial' from the 'If I don't answer' drop down menu.
Enter the phone number in the 'Dial the following number' box under 'If I don't answer'.
Enter the number of seconds for the phone to ring before proceed to the next option configured below.
Repeat step 4-6 if you have more numbers for the call to be forwarded to.

Click
button. The saved message appears on top of the screen.

section.title: Call forwarded in the combination of multiple numbers and different numbers in succession

listitem.para: Select 'Dial' from the drop down menu.
Enter the phone number in the 'Dial the following number' box.
Enter the number of seconds you want the phone to ring before proceed to next option configured below.

Click
button to add additional number(s). All of the numbers listed will be dialed all at once.
Select 'Dial' from the 'If I don't answer' drop down menu.
Enter the phone number in the 'Dial the following number' box under 'If I don't answer'.
Enter the number of seconds for the phone to ring before proceed to the next option configured below.

Click
button. The saved message appears on top of the screen.

section.para: Delete or Disable the number

listitem.para:
Click
to delete the number.

Click
to disable the number.

Click
to delete group of numbers.

section.title: Find Me/Follow Me Expiration Configuration
section.para: You can configure the expiration for the Find Me/Follow Me.

listitem.para: Select date, month, year, hour and minute from the drop down menu.

Click
when finish.

section.title: Find Me/Follow Me Expiration Notification
section.para: You can configure to receive expiration notification.

listitem.para: Click on the check box.
Enter the appropriate information.

Click
and the saved message appears.
The notification will be sent thirty minutes prior to the expiration time. The notification will include the time remaining before the configuration expires.

para.emphasis: Note: the system runs query at every half an hour looking for expiring configuration within the next hour to send notification.
Example: Using above configuration, the expiration time is 12:45PM, you will receive the notification message at 12:00PM that shows the configuration will expire in 45 minutes.

section.title: Attendant
section.para: The Attendant screen is used to configure the menu for the auto attendant. The auto attendant fields inbound calls and connects them to their desired destination by requiring the caller to press one of the pre-defined options. The caller can be connected to a particular number, extension or one of the Listen applications (i.e. Voicemail).

Click
to display the Attendant screen.
The Attendant screen consists of three tabs:

listitem.para: Menus: This screen allows you to configure the menu for the auto attendant.
Scheduled Event: This screen allows you to configure override welcoming menu prompts for holidays or other one-day exceptions.
Impromptu Event: This screen allows you to configure a temporary event for an unspecified time period.

section.para: On install, a "default" menu is created. This menu can be modified and additional menus can be added. The "default" menu will be used when no other time specific menu is configured. There must be at least one menu on the system. If the "default' menu is the only one configured, it can not be deleted.
Configuration Name: The name of the attendant menu configuration
Which menu (below) do callers hear first: The entry menu the caller will be directed to upon accessing the Attendant application when there is more than one menu configured.
Menu Label: The name of the menu.
Options Prompt: Select the audio file that will be played when the caller first enters the menu. A drop-down menu displays the available prompts or upload new prompt.

para.emphasis: Note: This prompt should provide the available menu options. These prompts are located in the /interact/apps/spotbuild/listen_autoAttendant/audio/ directory.

section.para: On Keypress: The sequence of keys to be pressed by the caller. Default is '0'.

listitem.para: Keypress configuration rules:
A keypress must be unique in each menu.

A question mark (?) can be used for wildcard. Each question mark represents one digit. The number of digits configured is the length of number the system is expecting. To configure three digits wildcard number you would set up three question marks. (see example above)
When configure a single number as a keypress, that number can not be used as a leading number for other keypress option.
Asterisk(*) and pound (#) can be used. If used as a single keypress, it can not be used again as a leading key for other keypress options, but is acceptable as a following keypress.

para.emphasis: Example: # is configured as keypress therefore, #5 can not be used as another keypress. However, 5# can be used. This also applies to *.

section.para: Play Prompt: Select the audio file that will be played when the caller press this key. A drop-down menu displays the available prompts or upload new prompt. The prompt is played before the action is performed.
Perform Action: The action to be performed by the auto attendant. A drop-down menu displays the following available options:

listitem.para: Go To A Menu: This will take the caller to another menu. When selected, another drop-down menu is displayed with the available menus. Select the desired menu.
Dial A Number: This will dial the specified number. When selected, a text field is displayed. Enter the number the auto attendant should dial.
Dial What They Pressed: This will dial the keys pressed by the caller. No additional inputs are made.
Route To An ACD: This will route the call to an ACD Skill. When selected, another drop-down menu is displayed which will display all configured ACD skills.

Launch An Application: This will launch the specified application. When selected, another drop-down menu is displayed with the available applications: (Note: only licensed applications appear in the drop-down menu)
After Hours: The application used to connect callers to after hours support phone number.
Attendant: The application used to connect inbound calls to designated destination.
Broadcast: The application used to broadcast messages over the phone system.
Conferencing: The application used to conference in multiple callers to the same call.
Custom: A custom application. If selected, enter the name of the custom application.
Direct Messages: The application used to direct calls to either voicemail or fax, depending on the type of calls.
Direct Voicemail: The application used for direct access to a mailbox. The main mailbox Menu is bypassed, going straight to retrieving messages.

para.emphasis: Note: If the number that you are calling in from is 7 digits or longer, then no passcode is required. If the number is less than 7 digits (i.e. your extension), then your passcode is still required.

listitem.para: Mailbox: The application used to retrieve voicemails.
Voicemail: The application used to leave a voicemail for a subscriber. (If not licensed, unanswered calls or calls fail would hear call not answered prompt).

para.emphasis: Note: If IP PBX is not licensed, no extended functionality of office phones are allowed (i.e. no transfer, no forward using soft keys etc..)

listitem.para: End the Call: This will terminate the call.
Replay This Menu: This will replay the menu to the caller.

section.para: The following two actions are required for every menu:

Other Input: The action to be performed by the auto attendant when the caller presses an undefined key or series of keys. Select an action from the drop-down menu (see above for the available actions).

Timeout (5s): The action to be performed by the auto attendant when the caller does not press any key within 5 seconds of entering the menu. Select an option from the drop-down menu (see above for the available actions).

section.title: Add New Configuration
section.para: To add new configuration

listitem.para:
Click
. The Configuration screen will appear.
Enter the Configuration Name.
Select the menu to hear first from the drop down list. If available.

Click
to restrict the time for this menu. The time configuration will appear.
Select From Time, To Time and day(s) of the week. The new configuration will apply only on the day and time configured.

section.title: Add New Menu
section.para: To Add new menu

listitem.para:
Click
button.
The Attendant menu will appear.
Enter the Menu Label.
Select Options Prompt from the drop-down menu.
Enter value for key press.
Select Play Prompt from the drop-down menu.
Select Perform Action. Based on the Perform Action type, additional information may be required.
Select Play Prompt from the drop-down menu for Other Input.
Select Perform Action from the drop-down menu for Other Input.
Select Play Prompt from the drop-down menu for Timeout.
Select Perform Action from the drop-down menu for Timeout.

Click
to add more action. Repeat step 5- 12.

Click
.

section.title: Edit Menu
section.para: All menus, including the "default" can be modified.

listitem.para: Select the menu to make changes.
Make the necessary changes.

Click
.

section.title: Delete Menu
section.para: All menus, including the "default" can be delete

listitem.para: Select the menu you want to delete.

Click
. A pop up message appears asking if you are sure.
Click Yes. The menu is removed from the screen.

section.title: Show/Hide Menu
section.para: All menus, including the "default" can be hidden. Only the Menu Label remains visible.

listitem.para:
Click
.
Only Menu Labels remain visible.

section.title: Scheduled Event
section.para: The Scheduled Event screen allows you to configure an override welcoming menu prompts for holidays or other one-day exceptions.

Click
to display the Scheduled Event Screen.
Date: The date to apply the override welcoming prompts
Select Prompt: Select the override welcoming prompt
Upload New Prompt: New prompt can be uploaded
Use Options From: The scheduled event will use options from this configuration.
Discard Link: Discard current changes.
Delete: Discard the scheduled event. This will only appear once an event has been created.

listitem.para: Select date from the drop down menu. Optionally click the All day option to apply to the current 24 hour period.
Select prompt from the drop down menu or upload a new prompt.
Select a configuration to use options from.

Click
and the saved message appears.

If you want to clear the screen and start over click
and the change is discarded.

Click
next to the record you want to delete and the deleted message appears.

section.title: Impromptu Event
section.para: The Impromptu Event Screen allows you to schedule a temporary event that will automatically last until the end of the current day. The event can be canceled to end earlier.

Click
to display the Impromptu Event Screen.
Select Prompt: Select the override welcoming prompt.

emphasis.emphasis: The impromptu event will use options from this configuration.

listitem.para: Select a prompt to play.
Select a configuration to use options from.
Click
Click

section.title: ACD
section.para: The ACD screen is used to manage Listen's Automatic Call Distribution features.

Click
to display the ACD screen.
The ACD screen consists of four tabs:
The ACD screen consists of five tabs:

listitem.para: Status: This screen allows you to set your current status and contact number. It also shows a quick summary of your call information.
Call Queue: This screen allows you to view incoming calls associated with your configured ACD skills.
Messages: This screen allows you to view voicemails for your configured ACD skills.
Call History: This screen allows you to view ACD calls you have personally attended to.
Agent Status: This screen allows you to view the status of all agents within your organization.

section.title: Status
section.para:
Click
to display the ACD status screen.
Status: Your call availability. Your status determines whether Listen will route incoming calls to you. There are three potential states.

listitem.para: Unavailable: Calls will not be routed to you. This is the default state.
Available: Calls will be routed to you.
Voicemail: This is a special status that cannot be configured manually. It is reserved for users selected as the voicemail user for a given skill.

section.para: Contact Number: The number Listen will try to contact you with.
Current Call: The ACD call you are currently on. There are five additional fields specific to this call.

listitem.para: Hold: Displays whether the call is on hold or not.
Caller: The ANI of the current call.
Skill: The requested skill for the current call. This will correspond to one of your own skills.
Transfer: Transfers the current call.
Disconnect: Disconnects the current call.

section.para: Waiting Calls: The first five calls queued calls associated with any of your configured ACD skills.
Call History: Your ACD call history for the current day. This will only display calls routed to you by the ACD system.

listitem.para:
Click the colored button,
, just below "Your Current ACD Status".

The color will change, as shown here,
, to indicate your were successful.

para.emphasis: Note: The status toggles, so if you were "Available", following the same procedure above will toggle your status to "Unavailable".

listitem.para:
Using the contact number select,
, found just below "Your ACD Contact Number", select a phone number.

para.emphasis: Note: The numbers displayed in the select must be previously configured as an extension or as a personal number via your profile.

listitem.para: Check the checkbox, under the label 'Hold'.

Click
to bring up a selection box with available agents to transfer the call to. You will see a selection box appear, as shown below.
Using the new selection box, choose one of the available agents.

Click
to finish transferring the call. Click
to cancel the transfer.

Click
, within the current call section, to disconnect the current call.

section.title: Call Queue
section.para: The call queue screen displays any incoming call that is associated with one of the agent's skills. It may also be configured to display all calls, regardless of the agent's skill set by assigning the ACD_Call_Queue or Administrator role to an agent.
Agent: The requested agent. The agent selected is determined by an algorithm that factors in the agent's skill priority and availability.
Caller: The caller ANI.
Skill: The caller's requested department.
Status: The current status of the call. Eight possible states.

listitem.para: WAITING: Waiting for an agent to become available.
CONNECT_REQUESTED: Waiting for the selected agent to answer.
CONNECTED: The select agent has answered, the call is now in progress.
COMPLETED: The call was completed successfully.
CONNECT_FAIL: The call was not answered due to agent availability or system malfunctions.
DISCONNECTED: The call was disconnected by the agent.
VOICEMAIL: The call was transferred to the agent's voicemail.
ENDED: The call was ended by the caller.

section.para: Wait Time: The total time the call has been in the queue.
Last Activity: The total time since the call was last updated.

Click
to display the ACD Call Queue Screen.

listitem.para:
Click
to send a call to voicemail, before it is directed to an agent.

section.title: Messages
section.para: The messages screen allows you to view voicemails for any of your associated skills. The Messages tab itself will indicate whether there are new voicemails for any skills by displaying the total count of new unread voicemails for all of your configured skills. By default, the messages screen will display a collection of all messages for all of your skills. You can manage the messages to only display messages for a specific skill.
From: The caller who left the message.
Received: The time since the message was left.
Status: The state of the message: new or old.

Click
to display the ACD Messages Screen.

listitem.para: Click the 'Play' link of the corresponding message you wish to listen to.

Click,
, or ,
, depending on the current state of the message.
The message will switch colors to indicate whether is old / new and display a different status.
Old:
New:

Click the
button corresponding to the message you wish to download.

Click the
button corresponding to the message you wish to delete.

Select the skill from the selection box,
, at the top of the screen, which defaults to 'All'.

para.emphasis: Note: The number of new messages for each skill will be listed next to the skill's name, helping to identify which skills have new messages.

listitem.para: The page will automatically refresh with the messages for the specific skill displayed.

section.title: Call History
section.para: The call history screen allows the user to view their call history, optionally filtered by time, skill, or agent, as well as export records to a CSV file. By default, the screen will show the call history for all of the current user's skills over the last the last 24 hours. For admins, the screen will show all calls within the last 24 hours.
Start Date: Only calls after the specified date will be displayed.
End Date: Only calls before the specified date will be displayed.
Skill: Calls will be filtered by the given skill. All skills are listed for admin users. Normal users may only filter by their configured skill set.
Agent: Calls will be filtered by the given skill. All agents are listed for admin users. Normal users can only see their own call history.

Click
to display the call history screen.

section.title: Filter History

listitem.para: Enter the starting date in the format MM/DD/YYYY.
Enter the ending date in the format MM/DD/YYYY.
Click on the skill select and select a skill.
Click on the agent select and select an agent.

Click the
button to refresh the page with the new results.

section.para: ACD Call History Filter:

section.title: Export to CSV

listitem.para: Optional: Use the filter steps above to filter the results. The export action will use the same parameters to sort the results.
Click the 'Export to CSV' link to download a CSV file, with the filtered results.

section.para: ACD Call History Export:

emphasis.guibutton: ACD Call History Export Field Definitions

section.para: timestamp : Gets the milliseconds of the 'began' instant from the Java epoch of 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.
began : The date and time of when the call started on the Listen platform. Format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS'
calling party : The number of the party making the call. For calls from numbers or extensions registered with the Listen system, the Listen user name will also be displayed.
called party : The number of the party that was called. For calls from numbers or extensions registered with the Listen system, the Listen user name will also be displayed.
duration : The duration of this call. Format 'HH:mm:SS'
organization : The organization name associated with this call.
call result : A text description of the call disposition of this call.
sessionId : The IVR session id associated with this call.
ivr : The IP address of the IVR that processed this call.
skill : The ACD skill name related to this ACD call.
enqueueTime : The date and time of when this ACD call entered the ACD queue. Format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS'.
dequeueTime : The date and time of when this ACD call left the ACD queue and was forwarded to an ACD agent. Format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS'.
agent : The username of the ACD agent that answered this ACD call.
agentCallStart : The date and time of when this ACD call was answered by the defined ACD agent. Format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS'.
agentCallEnd : The date and time of when this ACD call to the defined ACD agent ended. Format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS'.
agentTime : The time spent on the phone with the ACD agent defined by the 'agent' column.

section.title: Agent Status
section.para: The agent status screen shows the status of all agents within an organization for all skills. A table is displayed for each skill.
Agent: The agent's username.
Priority: The agent's priority for the given skill.
Status: The agent's call status.
Status Changed: The date when the agent's status was last updated.
Last Call Completed: The date of the last call completed by the agent.
Current Call Start: The date at which the agent's current call started. This will be blank in the event that there is not a call in progress.

Click
to display the agent status screen.

listitem.para:
Click the
or
button to toggle the agent's status.

section.title: Organizations
section.para: The organization screen is used to create new organizations and their routing numbers.

Click
to display the Organization screen.

glossterm.emphasis: The organization screen consists of three tabs:

glossdef.para: List: This screen lists all organizations.
Create: This screen is used to create new a organization.
Routing: This screen allows you to configure the organization routing numbers.

section.title: List
section.para: Name: The name of the organization created.
Edit: This option allows you to edit organization name and enable licensable features.
Delete: This option allows you to delete the organization.

Single Organization Mode: Select the organization to be used as a single organization mode. When selected, users can log in at the base URL path instead of a context-relative URL path. Custodian users must still log in from /custodian.

listitem.para:
Click
.

Make necessary changes. Click
.

Click
and Organization deleted message appears.

section.title: Create
section.para: The Create screen allows you to create a new organization.
Name: The name of the organization.
URL Path: The URL path for the organization.
Outbound Call ID: The outbound caller id for the organization.
Allow Mailbox's DID to Determine Outbound Caller ID: if checked, the mailbox's DID to be used as outbound caller id.
Extension Length: The number of digits in the extensions for the organization.
Outbound Route: The IP/host that all outbound calls will be routed through.
AD Server: The organizations active directory server hostname.
AD Domain: The organizations active directory server domain.
LDAP Base DN: The organizations active directory server LDAP base DN.
LDAP Port: The organizations active directory server LDAP port.
LDAP DC: The organizations active directory server LDAP DC.
Enabled Features: When selected, the feature is to be available for the organization. Available features are:

listitem.para: ACD: This feature enables Listen's Automatic Call Distribution.
After Hours: This feature allows you to configure the after hours number and alternate mobile number for after hours support.
Attendant: This feature allows you to configure prompts and handle keypresses for incoming calls.
PBX Broadcast: This feature allows you to broadcast messages over the phones system.
Conferencing: This feature allows you to schedule and manage conferences.
Custom SPOT Applications: This feature allow you to integrate the use of custom application.
Fax: This feature allow you to send and receive fax in the PDF format using the GUI.
Find Me/Follow Me: This feature allows you to configure the way incoming calls are handled.
Transcription: This feature transcribes voicemail message into text message on the GUI and Android app.
Voicemail: This feature allows you to listen and manage voicemail.
IP PBX: This feature allows extended functionality for calls and intraoffice communication. Calls between two phones on the network can use forwarding and transferring keys etc.

para.emphasis: Note: If a feature is not licensed, it is not displayed.

section.para: Username: The name used to log in to the Listen GUI.
Password: The password used to log in to the Listen GUI.
Confirm Password: The password that needs to match the password used to log in to the Listen GUI.
Real Name: The real name of the user.
Email Address: The email address of the user.

listitem.para:
Click
and the Create Organization screen appears.
Enter the information.

Click
and the organization is created.

listitem.para:
Click
and Edit Organization screen appears.
Make necessary changes.

Click
and the change is saved.

section.para: Name: The name of the organization.
URL Path: The URL path for the organization.
Outbound Call ID: The outbound caller id for the organization.
Allow Mailbox's DID to Determine Outbound Caller ID: if checked, the mailbox's DID to be used as outbound caller id.
Extension Length: The number of digits in the extensions for the organization.
Outbound Route: The IP/host that all outbound calls will be routed through.
AD Server: The organizations active directory server hostname.
AD Domain: The organizations active directory server domain.
LDAP Base DN: The organizations active directory server LDAP base DN.
LDAP Port: The organizations active directory server LDAP port.
LDAP DC: The organizations active directory server LDAP DC.
CDR Url: The URL path for the CDR posting.
Enable cdr post to external server : When checked, it enables the CDR posting to external server mentioned in CDR Url.
Enabled Features: When selected, the feature is to be available for the organization. Available features are:

listitem.para: ACD: This feature enables Listen's Automatic Call Distribution.
After Hours: This feature allows you to configure the after hours number and alternate mobile number for after hours support.
Attendant: This feature allows you to configure prompts and handle keypresses for incoming calls.
PBX Broadcast: This feature allows you to broadcast messages over the phones system.
Conferencing: This feature allows you to schedule and manage conferences.
Custom SPOT Applications: This feature allow you to integrate the use of custom application.
Fax: This feature allow you to send and receive fax in the PDF format using the GUI.
Find Me/Follow Me: This feature allows you to configure the way incoming calls are handled.
Transcription: This feature transcribes voicemail message into text message on the GUI and Android app.
Voicemail: This feature allows you to listen and manage voicemail.
IP PBX: This feature allows extended functionality for calls and intraoffice communication. Calls between two phones on the network can use forwarding and transferring keys etc.

para.emphasis: Note: If a feature is not licensed, it is not displayed.

section.para: Username: The name used to log in to the Listen GUI.
Password: The password used to log in to the Listen GUI.
Confirm Password: The password that needs to match the password used to log in to the Listen GUI.
Real Name: The real name of the user.

section.title: Routing
section.para: The Routing screen allows you to assign specific routing number to the organization. The number will route the caller to specific application.
Pattern: The number the caller from specific organization dials to get to the application. Asterisks can be used for wildcard.
Destination Organization: The organization to which the number is assigned to.
Destination Application: The application the caller will be routed to.

listitem.para:
Click
and the screen appears.
Enter the phone number.
Select the Destination Organization from the drop down menu.
Select the Destination Application from the drop down menu.

Click
and the Route created message appears.

and the screen appears.
Make necessary changes.

Click
and Route saved message appears.

and the screen appears.
