section.title: Administration
section.para: The Administration screen consists of ten tabs:

listitem.para: Routing
Extensions
Outdialing
Configuration
ACD Skills
Android
Call History
Action History
Reports
Templates

section.title: Routing
section.para: The Routing screen allows you to set up dialing numbers to direct callers to appropriate applications. You can also view pre-defined dialing numbers.
Pattern: The phone number, IP address, hostname, extension, etc. of what the subscriber will need to call into to access the application.

para.emphasis: Note: Wildcards (*) can be used. If set to just '*', then any IVR configured number not assigned to a different application will be routed to that application. It can also be used to wildcard a specific number (i.e. 1-800-555-1* or 77*, so all calls to a number starting with either of those values will be routed to that specific application).
Note: External Numbers are not modifiable. Only custodian can modify external numbers.

section.para: Routes To: The application assigned to the Number. A drop-down list displays the following possible applications (based on licensing):

listitem.para: After Hours: The application used to connect callers to after hours support phone number.
Attendant: The application used to direct caller to specific application based on the keypresses
Broadcast: The application used for paging over the phones system (default is 799).
Conferencing: The conferencing application (default is 990).
Mailbox: The mailbox administration application used to retrieve voicemail (default is 770).
Voicemail: The application used to leave a voicemail for a subscriber (default is *).
Direct Message: The application used to direct a call to either voicemail or fax depending on the call type.
Direct Voicemail: The application used for direct access to a mailbox (default is 880). The main Mailbox Menu is bypassed, going straight to retrieving messages.

para.emphasis: Note: If the number that you are calling in from is 7 digits or longer, then no passcode is required. If the number is less than 7 digits (i.e. your extension), then your passcode is still required.

listitem.para: Custom: A custom application. If selected, the name of the custom application is displayed.
IP PBX: The application used to enable the office phone functionality such as dialing, transfer, conference, forward etc..

Click
and the Routing screen appears.
Enter the appropriate information in Pattern.
Select Routes to from the drop down menu.

Click
and the Route Added message appears.

Click
and the Routing screen appears.
Make necessary changes.

Click
and the Routing saved message appears.

Click
and the Routing screen appears.

Click
of the number you want to delete. The Route deleted message appears.

section.title: Extensions
section.para: The Extensions screen allows you to create and assign extension numbers to a user.
Number: The number to be assigned to a user.
Belongs To: The user whose the number is assigned to.

Phone Username: The username the phone will send when registering. This value defaults to the user's unique identifier. If this value is not used, an identifier should be used which is unique across all organizations.
Phone Password: The password the phone will send when registering.
Confirm Password: Repeat the Phone Password.
IP Address: The IP address of the IP Phone.
Last SIP Activity: The last time SIP activity was detected from this phone.

listitem.para:
Click
and the Extensions screen appears.

Select the user to which the number belongs from the Belongs To drop down menu.

Enter the Phone Password.
Confirm the Phone Password.

and the Phone number created message appears. The extension is added to the list. Note that the IP Address will be populated when the phone is first registered.

Click
and the Add Extensions screen appears.
Make necessary changes.

on the record that has been changed. The Extension saved message appears.

Click
and the Add Extensions screen appears.

section.para: The Outdialing screen allows you to restrict certain numbers that certain users are not allowed to dial.

listitem.para: Global Restrictions: Restricted numbers configured at custodian level. These numbers are not modifiable.

para.emphasis: Restrictions

For User: The type of user not allowed to dial restricted number.

para.emphasis: Exceptions

listitem.para: Allow: The type of user allowed to dial restricted number.
To Dial: The restricted number certain user allowed to dial.

section.title: Configuration
section.para: This screen allows you to do the following:

listitem.para: Enable and configure Audio Transcription
Configure After Hours Mobile number
Configure new Conference PIN length

section.para:
Click
and the Configuration screen appears.

section.title: Audio Transcription
section.para: This section allows you to enable or disable audio transcription
Enable Transcriptions: When selected the voicemail audio will be transcribed.
Twilio Phone Number: The phone number of the third party software that the .wav file will be sent to for transcription.

listitem.para: To Enable Transcriptions
Select Enable Transcriptions box
Enter Twilio Phone Number.
Click and Saved message appears.
To Disable Transcriptions
De-select Enable Transcriptions box
Click and Saved message appears.

section.title: After Hours Support
section.para: This section allows you to set up an alternate number to receive the After Hours Pager text.

para.emphasis: Note: if not licensed, the After Hours Page section will not be displayed

section.para: After Hours Mobile Number: The number that will be paged and text notification will be sent to when there is a new voice message for the After Hours Support.
Alternate Mobile Number: The additional number that the text notification will be sent to when there is a new voice message for the After Hours Support.
Alternate Number Mobile Provider: The service provider of the alternate number.
Realize System URL: The name of the central collector and monitoring system.

para.emphasis: Example: http://vmrealize:8080/realize

section.para: Realize Alert Name: The name of the alerts configured on the realize system to send out notification when alternate mobile number is updated.

listitem.para: Enter/update the appropriate information.

Click
. An alternate number updated message is displayed.
Updates are saved for both the GUI and TUI.

section.title: Conferencing
section.para: New Conference PIN Length: The Conference PIN length when a new user is created.

section.title: ACD Skills
section.para:
Click
to display the ACD Skills Screen.
Skill Name: The name of the skill. This will be displayed when referencing the skill on other screens.
Users Assigned: The number of users assigned to the skill.
Menus Assigned: The numbers of menus assigned to the skill.

listitem.para: Enter the name and description of the skill.

Click
and the Skill Created message appears.
Edit the skill, using the steps below, to remove assigned users.

The
button will remain disabled until all users are removed.

Click the
button corresponding to the skill you wish to delete.

Click
to edit the corresponding skill. You will be redirected to the edit skills screen.
Edit the appropriate fields.
Skill Name: The name of the skill. This will be displayed on all screens that reference the skill.
Skill Description: The skill's description.
Skill Assigned Users: The users assigned the skill. Selected users will be highlighted. Multiple users can be assigned by holding Ctrl.
Associated Voicemail User: Voicemails for this skill will be deflected to this user's voicemail box.
On Hold Prompt Selection: The prompt to play when a caller is placed on hold. This is played before the hold music begins playing.

Extended On Hold Prompt Selection: After the on hold prompt and the hold music have each played three times, Listen will begin to play the extended message in the place on the on hold message until the caller connects with an agent or decides to leave a voicemail.
On Hold Music Selection: The music played to the caller on hold. It will loop indefinitely.
Call Connect Prompt Selection: This prompt plays when the caller is connected with an agent associated with the skill.

Click
to save the new settings. You will be redirected back to the skill list if successful. You will remain on the edit skill screen if there was an error.

section.title: Android
section.para: The Android screen displays the Listen Android application account. Users can download the Listen app on their smartphones, configure Listen URL, login and password. The application allows users to access voicemails and contact list.

Enable Android Cloud-to-Device: When selected, Google will contact Listen application to get query from Listen server for new voicemails and contact list. When not selected, the smartphone will query Listen server directly.
Google Account: The name of the account when registered with Google to use cloud development. This is registered as a company not individual user.
Password: The password of the account when registered with Google.
Authorization Token: The encrypted string values assigned by Google when registered to use cloud development.

listitem.para: Enter appropriate information.

Click
and the Saved message appears.

section.title: Call History
section.para: The Call History displays all of the Call Detail Records (CDR) generated by Listen. All calls (inbound, outbound, completed and failed) are displayed.

The CDRs are displayed in order from newest to oldest by date/time with 25 records per page. To view additional records click
or
.
Each CDR contains the following basic information:

glossentry.glossterm: Call History: all calls (inbound, outbound, completed and failed) are displayed.

glossdef.para: Began: The date and time of the call record

para.emphasis: Note: Call history DRs are not generated until the call has ended.

glossdef.para: Calling Party: The name of the caller.
Called Party: The name of the call recipient.
Duration: The length of the call.
Call Result: The result of the call (Call Answered, No answered or Call failed).

section.title: Search Call History

listitem.para: Enter the start date in the format MM/DD/YYYY.
Enter the end date in the format MM/DD/YYYY.
Enter the caller number in the "Caller" tab.
Enter the callee number in the "Callee" tab.
Enter the call result in the "Call Result" tab.
Select the user from the "Users" tab for whom you want to do the search.

Click the
button to refresh the page with the new search results.

Click the
button to reset the search options.

section.para: Call History Search:

section.title: Export to CSV

listitem.para: Optional: Use the search steps above to search the results. The export action will use the same parameters to sort the results.
Click the 'Export to CSV' link to download a CSV file, with the filtered results.

section.para: Call History Export:
timestamp : Gets the milliseconds of the 'began' instant from the Java epoch of 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.
began : The date and time of when the call started on the Listen platform. Format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS'
calling party : The number of the party making the call. For calls from numbers or extensions registered with the Listen system, the Listen user name will also be displayed.
called party : The number of the party that was called. For calls from numbers or extensions registered with the Listen system, the Listen user name will also be displayed.
duration : The duration of this call. Format 'HH:mm:SS'
organization : The organization name associated with this call.
call result : A text description of the call disposition of this call.
sessionId : The IVR session id associated with this call.
ivr : The IP address of the IVR that processed this call.

emphasis.guibutton: /* The following fields will only be populated for ACD calls */

section.para: skill : The ACD skill name related to this ACD call.
enqueueTime : The date and time of when this ACD call entered the ACD queue. Format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS'.
dequeueTime : The date and time of when this ACD call left the ACD queue and was forwarded to an ACD agent. Format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS'.
agent : The username of the ACD agent that answered this ACD call.
agentCallStart : The date and time of when this ACD call was answered by the defined ACD agent. Format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS'.
agentCallEnd : The date and time of when this ACD call to the defined ACD agent ended. Format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:SS'.
agentTime : The time spent on the phone with the ACD agent defined by the 'agent' column.

section.title: Action History
section.para: The Action History displays all of the Action Detail Records (ADR) generated by Listen. Any type of actions performed on TUI or GUI are displayed.

The ADRs are displayed in order from newest to oldest by date/time with 25 records per page. To view additional records click
or
.
Each ADR contains the following basic information:

glossentry.glossterm: Action History: any type of actions performed on TUI or GUI are displayed.

glossdef.para: Date: The date and time (mm/dd/yy:hh:mm:ss) the action was performed.
User: The user name of the subscriber who performed the action.
On User: The user name of the subscriber who action was performed upon.
Description: A short description of the action.

listitem.para: For action history DRs, this includes a generic description of the action, whether it was performed on the TUI or GUI and some basic information about the action. This can include one or more of the following:
Caller Number
Conference Description
Old Value
New Value
Date/Time

glossdef.para: Channel: The channel through which the user performed the action. TUI or GUI.

listitem.para: Enter the start date in the format MM/DD/YYYY.
Enter the end date in the format MM/DD/YYYY.

button to reset the search options.

Date : The date and time (mm/dd/yy:hh:mm:ss) the action was performed.

Description: A short description of the action.

listitem.para: For action history DRs, this includes a generic description of the action, whether it was performed on the TUI or GUI and some basic information about the action. This can include one or more of the following:
Caller Number

Old Value
New Value
Date/Time

section.title: Templates
section.para: The Templates screen displays the Listen Provisioner templates. Administrators can add, update, and delete templates.

listitem.para: Enter the name of the template.

Click
and the Template Created message appears.

and the Template Deleted message appears.
Click the Template Name and you will be redirected to the Edit Template page.

glossentry.glossterm: The edit screen consists of two editable fields:

glossdef.para: Template Names: The name of the template.

Template: The template that will be compiled when the IP Phone requests it from the provisioning server. If you would like to bypass templating, you can add the files directly to the provisioning server located at the default location of /interact/provisioner/root/. The following variables are allowed to be used within this field:
<%=number%> Extension number
<%=userId%> "User ID" from extension
<%=username%> "Username" from extension
<%=password%> "Password" from extension
<%=organizationId%> Organization Id of Extension
<%=realName%> Real name of user assigned to the extension
<%=macAddress%> Mac Address assigned to this extension

section.title: Administration
section.para: The Administration screen allows you to configure outdialing restrictions. You can also configure mail server settings.

glossentry.glossterm: The screen consists of two tabs:

glossdef.para: Outdialing: This screen allows you to set up numbers callers are not allowed to dial.
Mail: This screen allows you to set up mail server setting.

section.title: Outdialing
section.para: The Outdialing screen allows you to set up numbers that prohibit callers from dialing for all organizations.
Add Global Restriction: The dialing number the caller is not allowed to call.

section.title: Mail
section.para: The Mail screen allows you to configure the mail server settings for sending conference schedules and voicemail notifications.
Host: The name of the SMTP server that will be sending the email notifications (default is 'localhost').
Username: The username for the SMTP server.
Password: The password for the SMTP server.
Default from Address: The email address that will be specified in the "From" field of the email notifications (default is 'listen@localhost').

para.emphasis: Note: The 'localhost' will be replaced with the name of your localhost.

section.title: Users
section.para: The Users screen consists of three tabs:

listitem.para: List: This screen lists all the users on the system.
Create: This screen allows you to create new user.
Permissions: This screen allows you to set user permissions.

section.title: List
section.para: The List screen displays all the users on the system.
Username: The name used to log in to the Listen GUI.
Real Name: The user's real name.
Enabled: If checked, the user is active and able to make calls, receive voicemails and log in to the GUI.
Active Directory: If checked, it indicates the account is defined on the company's Active Directory server. Username and password may not be changed.
Last Login: The last time the user logged in to the Listen GUI.

listitem.para:
Click
and the Edit User screen appears.
Make necessary changes.

Click
and the User updated message appears.

Click
on the user you want to disable. The User disabled message appears.

Click
on the user you want to enable. The User enabled message appears.

Before you can delete a user, you must first Disable the user by clicking
on the user you want to delete. The
button will appear on the disabled user row.

Click
on the user you want to delete. Click OK in the confirmation dialog. The User Deleted message appears.

section.title: Create
section.para: The Create screen allows you to create a new user.
Username: The name used to log in to the Listen GUI.
Password: The password used to log in to the Listen GUI.
Confirm Password: The password that needs to match the Password above to log in to the Listen GUI.
Real Name: The user's real name.
Email Address: The email address of the user.
Number: The office phone number of the user. This is optional. If assigns here, the number will be populated on the Phones tab under Administration screen as well.
IP Address: The IP address of the user's SIP phone. This is optional.

listitem.para:
Click
and the Create User screen appears.
Enter appropriate information.

Click
and the User created message appears.

section.title: Permissions
section.para: The Permissions screen allows you to set the user permissions.
Username: The name used to log in to the Listen GUI.
Real Name: The user's real name.
Enabled: Whether the user is enabled (checkmark) or not (blank).
Permissions: Whether or not the user has permission to each of the following permissions:

listitem.para: ACD
ACD Call Queue
Administration
Attendant
Conferencing
Fax
Find Me/Follow Me
Voicemail

Click
and the Permissions screen appears.
Check/uncheck the box for Administration or Attendant.
The change is immediately made and the Granted/Revoked message appears.

section.title: Profile
section.para: The Profile screen consists the following tabs:

listitem.para: Settings: This screen allows you to update general settings.
Phones: This screen allows you to configure personal phone number.
After Hours: This screen allows you to configure the alternate mobile number.
History: This screen allows you to view call history and action history.
History: This screen allows you to view action history.

section.title: Settings
section.para: The Settings screen allows you to update general settings of the user.
Username: The log in name to the Listen GUI.

para.emphasis: Note: This cannot be changed.

section.para: New Password: Used to enter new password.

para.emphasis: Note: If this is an Active Directory account, your password cannot be changed.

section.para: Confirm New Password: Used to re-enter new password.
Real Name: The user's real name.
Email Address: The email address of the user.
User Skills: A table of the user's skills. The user's priority for each skill can be updated here as well.

listitem.para: Enter the appropriate information in each field.

Click
and the Saved message appears.

section.title: Phones
section.para: The Phones screen allows you to configure personal phone numbers and also display your extension number.
Extension: The office extension assigned to the user.
Mobile Phones: Any other mobile phone numbers belonging to the user.
Other Phones: Any other phone numbers belonging to the user.
Category: The category to which the phone number belongs to.
Public: If selected, the phone number would be visible to all users.

listitem.para: Enter the number in the Number field.
Select category from the drop down menu.
Click Public (optional)

Click
and the Phone saved message appears.
Make necessary changes.

Click
and the Phone saved message appears.

Click
on the record you want to delete. The Phone Deleted message appears.

section.title: After Hours
section.para: The After Hours screen allows you to configure alternate mobile number for the after hours phone number.
Alternate Mobile Number: The additional number that the text notification will be sent to when there is a new voice message for the After Hours Support.
Mobile Provider: The service provider of the alternate number.

listitem.para: Enter/update the alternate mobile number.
Select the mobile provider.

Click
and the saved message appears.

section.title: History
section.para: The History displays all of the Detail Records (DR) generated by Listen for your user.

The DRs are displayed in order from newest to oldest by date/time with 25 records per page. To view additional records click
or
. They are also color coded based on the application that generated the record:

listitem.para: General Listen actions are not highlighted. Possible general DRs include:
Logged in/out of the GUI
Created/Deleted subscriber
Changed pager alternate number
Conferencing records are highlighted in blue. Possible DRs for conferencing include:
Conference started/stopped
Caller muted/unmuted/dropped
Recording started/stopped
Voicemail records are highlighted in yellow. Possible DRs for voicemail include:
Change of voicemail passcode/greeting
Deleted voicemail
Downloaded voicemail
Forwarding voicemail
FindMe records are highlighted in red.

section.para: There are two types of history:

listitem.para: Call History: All calls (inbound, outbound, completed and failed) are displayed.
Action History: Any type of actions performed on the GUI are displayed.
Action History: Any type of actions performed on TUI or GUI are displayed.

section.para: Each DR contains the following basic information:

glossentry.glossterm: Call History: All calls (inbound, outbound, completed and failed) are displayed.

glossdef.para: Began: The date and time of the call record

para.emphasis: Note: Call history DRs are not generated until the call has ended.

glossdef.para: Calling Party: The name of the caller.
Called Party: The name of the call recipient.
Duration: The length of the call.
Call Result: The result of the call (Call Answered, No answered or Call failed).

glossentry.glossterm: Action History: Any type of actions performed on the TUI or GUI are displayed.

glossdef.para: Date: The date and time (mm/dd/yy:hh:mm:ss) the action was performed.
User: The user name of the subscriber who performed the action. And the user name of the subscriber who the action was performed upon, if applicable.
Description: A short description of the action.

listitem.para: For action history DRs, this includes a generic description of the action, whether it was performed on the TUI or GUI and some basic information about the action. This can include one or more of the following:
Caller Number
Conference Description
Old Value
New Value
Date/Time

glossdef.para: Channel: The channel through which the user performed the action. TUI or GUI.

section.title: History
section.para: The History displays all of the Detail Records (DR) generated by Listen for the Custodian.

The DRs are displayed in order from newest to oldest by date/time with 25 records per page. To view additional records click
or
.

listitem.para: Possible general DRs include:
Logged in/out of the GUI
Created/Deleted subscriber

glossentry.glossterm: Action History: Any type of actions performed on the GUI are displayed.

glossdef.para: Date: The date and time (mm/dd/yy:hh:mm:ss) the action was performed.
User: The user name of the subscriber who performed the action. And the user name of the subscriber who the action was performed upon, if applicable.
Description: A short description of the action.

listitem.para: For action history DRs, this includes a generic description of the action, whether it was performed on the TUI or GUI and some basic information about the action. This can include one or more of the following:
Caller Number
Conference Description
Old Value
New Value
Date/Time

glossdef.para: Channel: The channel through which the user performed the action. This will always be GUI.

section.title: Organization Brand
section.para: The Listen logo is provisioned upon install. However, a customized logo can be uploaded.

section.title: Logout
section.para: The Logout option is a security feature for subscribers who will be away from their system.

Click
to completely end the user session. You are returned to the login screen.

section.para: API's are available for performing tasks from an external system without using the GUI or TUI.
